summary: This FBI 302 form documents a phone interview with attorney Brad Edwards on November 1, 2019. Edwards provides information about a potential witness, a former butler for Glen Dubin and Eva Anderson, who was previously deposed in a Maxwell lawsuit and may be useful for the government to interview. The document notes the deposition is under seal and the individual resides in New York.

persons.context: Interviewed by the FBI over the phone on November 1, 2019, to relay information about a potential witness in the investigation.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: Referenced in relation to a lawsuit in which the potential witness was previously deposed; the deposition is under seal.

events.title: FBI interview with Brad Edwards
events.description: Attorney Brad Edwards was interviewed over the phone by an FBI agent to provide information about a potential witness in the investigation.

events.title: Deposition in Maxwell lawsuit
events.description: A former butler for Glen Dubin and Eva Anderson was deposed as part of a lawsuit involving Maxwell; the deposition is under seal.

keyFacts: Attorney Brad Edwards contacted the FBI to suggest interviewing a former butler for Glen Dubin and Eva Anderson as a potential witness.
The former butler was previously deposed in a lawsuit involving Maxwell, and that deposition is under seal.
The potential witness resides in New York and has a Facebook page, according to Edwards.
The FBI document is an interview summary (302 form) dated January 14, 2020, regarding an interview conducted on November 1, 2019.
